Welcome to rest_api’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.custom_middleware(request: Request, call_next)¶

The custom_middleware function is a middleware function that adds the time it took to process the request in seconds as a header called ‘perfomance’

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Pass the request object to the middleware function

  • call_next – Pass the request to the next middleware in line

Returns:

A response with the performance header

Doc-author:

ms

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something is wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A dictionary with the message &quot;welcome to fastapi!&quot;

async main.root(request: Request)¶

The root function returns a JSON object with the message ‘Hello world!’

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object

Returns:

A dictionary with the key ‘message’ and value ‘hello world!’

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, such as databases or caches.

Returns:

A fastapilimiter object

REST API repository contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, db: Session, user_id: int)¶
The create function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactModel): The contact to create. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user_id – int: Get the user_id from the token

Returns:

The contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: Session, user_id: int)¶
The get_contact_by_email function takes in an email and a user_id,

then returns the contact associated with that email.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the contact we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass in a database session object

  • user_id – int: Filter the contact by user_id

Returns:

The contact with the specified email address

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session, user_id: int)¶
The get_contact_by_id function takes in a contact_id and user_id, then returns the contact with that id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object. db (Session): A database session to query from. user_id (int): The id of the User who owns this Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user_id – int: Filter the contacts by user_id

Returns:

A contact object that matches the id and user_id passed in

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_name(name: str, db: Session, user_id: int)¶
The get_contact_by_name function takes in a name and returns all contacts with that name.
Args:

name (str): The contact’s first or last name. db (Session): A database session object to query the database for the contact. user_id (int): The id of the user who owns this contact, used to filter out other users’ contacts from our results.

Parameters:

  • name – str: Filter the contacts by name

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • user_id – int: Filter the contacts by user_id

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_surname(surname: str, db: Session, user_id: int)¶

The get_contact_by_surname function returns a list of contacts with the given surname.

Parameters:

  • surname – str: Filter the contacts by surname

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user_id – int: Filter the contacts by user_id

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given surname

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session, user_id: int)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user_id – int: Filter the contacts by user_id

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.repository.contacts.get_nearly_birthdays(db: Session, user_id: int)¶

The get_nearly_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within 7 days from the current date.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

  • user_id – int: Filter the contacts by user_id

Returns:

All contacts that have a birthday in the next 7 days

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, db: Session, user_id: int)¶
The remove function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be deleted. db (Session): A connection to the database. user_id (int): The id of the user who owns this contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user_id – int: Check if the contact belongs to the user

Returns:

The contact that was removed

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session, user_id: int)¶
The update function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated version of the ContactModel object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user_id – int: Check if the contact belongs to the user

Returns:

The contact object

REST API repository users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user that is being confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

ms

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object to be created. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object used for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

The user object that was created

Doc-author:

ms

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → Users | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object if the email is found in the database

Doc-author:

ms

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url, db) → Users¶
The update_avatar function takes in an email and a url, then updates the avatar of the user with that email.
Args:

email (str): The user’s unique identifier. url (str): The new URL for the avatar image.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – Update the avatar url of a user

  • db – Pass in the database connection to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

ms

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: Users, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (Users): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our PostgreSQL database.

Parameters:

  • user – Users: Pass in the user object from the database

  • refresh_token – Update the refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

ms

REST API routes auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular record to

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If there is no valid user associated with the given email address or if there are no tokens associated with that user, then an HTTPException will be raised.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored in the database. A background task sends an email to the user with their username.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background task queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A usermodel object

Doc-author:

ms

REST API routes contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – Users: Get the user_id from the current user

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer as a parameter, which is the ID of the contact to be deleted. It also takes in two dependencies: db and current_user.

  • db is used to access our database session, so we can make changes to it (in this case deleting).

  • current_user is used for authentication purposes; only users who are logged into their account can delete contacts.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to delete

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Users: Get the user id of the currently logged in user

Returns:

The deleted contact

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. The function takes in an integer value for the contact_id, which is then passed into the get_contact_by_id function of repository/contacts.py. The get_contact function returns a JSON object containing all information about a specific contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Users: Get the user id of the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_email(contact_email: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact by email.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • contact_email (str): The email of the contact to be returned.

  • db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (Users, optional): Current user object from auth middleware. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • contact_email – str: Specify the email of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_name(contact_name: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_name function is used to retrieve a contact by name.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • contact_name (str): The name of the contact you wish to retrieve.

  • db (Session, optional): A database Session instance that will be used for querying data from the database. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (Users, optional): An instance of Users representing the currently logged-in user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • contact_name – str: Get the contact name from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Users: Get the current user’s id

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_surname(contact_surname: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_surname function is used to retrieve a contact by surname.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • contact_surname (str): The surname of the contact you wish to retrieve.

  • db (Session, optional): A database Session instance that will be used for querying data from the database.

    Defaults to None if not provided. If no value is provided, a new Session instance will be created and used instead. This parameter should only be set when testing this function as it allows us to mock out our database connection for testing purposes.

Parameters:

  • contact_surname – str: Pass the surname of the contact to be searched for

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given surname

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the starting point of the query

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_nearly_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_nearly_birthdays function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the next 30 days.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id, body and db as parameters. It returns a ContactModel object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to update

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – Users: Get the current user from the database

A contactmodel object

REST API routes users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It requires authentication, and it uses the auth_service dependency to get the current user.

Parameters:

current_user – Users: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user, which is passed to the function as a dependency

Doc-author:

ms

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: Users = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a Users object, which is the current_user who’s avatar will be updated. Finally it takes in a Session object, which is used for database transactions.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – Users: Get the current user’s email from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

ms

REST API services auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: Token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

UserRouter class. It takes in a token and db session, and returns the user object associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables and methods

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password that can be stored in the database

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is being verified

  • hashed_password – Store the hashed password in the database

Returns:

A boolean value

class src.services.auth.ConfigKey¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
class src.services.auth.Token¶

Bases: object

config¶

alias of ConfigKey

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary of key-value pairs to include in the payload of the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional timedelta object that represents how long this token should last.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Define the time in seconds that the token will expire

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data passed to it

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM from the config file. The expiration date for this token is set to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded using jwt

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes and methods

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id and username to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

The encoded refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If it fails, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Decode the refresh token

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their token

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses PyJWT to decode the JWT, which is then used to retrieve the email address from its payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request

Returns:

The email that is stored in the token

REST API services email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that they can click on within their browser.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object
